primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human subject expands their personal experience of erotic love (Eros) into a universal state of being (Agape/God) to overcome social and hierarchical fragmentation.

tekstueel_bewijs: Ich habe mich kennengelernt als jemanden, der zu dem großen Alles fähig war

object.identificatie: The 'Great All' (Das große Alles) / Universal Eroticization

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the one who must expand their love).

tekstueel_bewijs: weil ihm das große Alles entgegenkam
helper.rol_van_god: God is a 'vocabulary' (Vokabel) or a state of being, not an active Subject.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is a historical-ideological construct that prevents human flourishing.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The dismantling of social inequality through the power of love.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The one living in a successful relationship
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (internal erotic expansion) enables the secondary (social justice).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Erotic Success → Human Subject ← Church Tradition
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Human Subject → Erotization of the Whole

voorbeelden_god_subject: In Gott ist genau der Zustand...
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Ich verstehe das Christentum als eine Anleitung...

voorbeelden: Anleitung, das Leben so zu leben
zu dem großen Alles fähig war

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a recruitment of desire. It assumes that if the hearer wants unity and understands the erotic mechanism, they have the power to expand it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the semantic redefinition of 'God' as the state of total erotic unity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is seen as a historical mistake, not a cosmic or ontological condition (Sin).

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Though it uses 'erotic' language rather than 'legalistic' language, it is anthropocentric. The human is the subject of the transformation; God is merely a name for the goal.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Ich verstehe das Christentum als eine Anleitung, das Leben so zu leben...
Ich habe mich kennengelernt als jemanden, der zu dem großen Alles fähig war

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: weil ihm das große Alles entgegenkam

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher's own erotic experience serves as the primary model for the possibility of fulfilling the biblical command.
bijbelse_figures_als_model: Jesus (as a messenger of this idea)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the Lover who loves the unlovable (Agape), enabling the human to love because they are first loved by an external Subject.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'eroticize' all of life based on personal peak experiences.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is self-actualization through the expansion of human eros.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a secular-humanist manifesto, but low coherence with the biblical text's own actantial structure (where Love is a gift of the Spirit).
spanning_punten: The text says 'Love bears all', but the preacher says 'I am capable of this because of my erotic experience'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Anleitung, das Leben so zu leben...

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The erotic experience provides the competence, not the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a psychological expansion of the self. The human 'I' is the Subject, Erotic Success is the Helper, and God is the Object/Value.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The preacher is the subject of the ability to love.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the Subject who loves the 'un-erotic' and the 'un-lovable'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Not: 'I found I was capable of everything,' but: 'God's love reached me when I was capable of nothing.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the 'unlovable' parts of the self that need to be loved by God first.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Pouvoir as a gift (I can only because He does).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that 1 Cor 13 is a description of Christ, not a to-do list for our erotic lives.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Recognize the 'Opponent' as the radical inability of the human heart to love selflessly.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, grace is just a 'vocabulary' for human potential.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (how to love) has swallowed Soteriology (how we are saved).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God loves us (Soteriology). 2. Therefore we can love (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and psychologically insightful, but structurally it replaces the Gospel with a 'Gospel of Eros' where the human remains the master of their own transformation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, it is inclusive; semiotically, it is exclusive to those with 'successful erotic experiences'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would show Paul is talking about the Body of Christ; the sermon talks about erotic couples.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'God' is not an actant here, but a semantic label for a human state.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Expressive Individualism' cloaked in theological vocabulary.
